texts.text: Ferdinand de Saussure was a Swiss linguist and semiotician known for his contributions to structural linguistics.

tooltip.text: A linguistic approach that views language as a structured system of interrelated elements.

texts.text: Saussure's concept of the linguistic sign consists of the signifier and the signified.

tooltip.text: A fundamental unit of meaning in language, consisting of a sound-image (signifier) and concept (signified).
